sentences.en: 'Carnage at Airport ', screamed the tabloid headline.
sentences.cn: 通俗小报的标题耸人听闻: “ 机场喋血”.

sentences.en: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
sentences.cn: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

sentences.en: Detectives smash London vice ring, eg in a newspaper headline.
sentences.cn: 警探侦破伦敦黄赌毒团伙(如报刊标题).

sentences.en: Every ad had a headline, and so did every paragraph.
sentences.cn: 每个广告都有标题, 每一段都有标题.

sentences.en: He became a general - assignment anchor at CNN Headline News in July.
sentences.cn: 他从7月份开始担任有线新闻电视公司(CNN)(标题新闻)栏目的总编排.
他把一些标题摆出来作证.

sentences.en: He had brightened at having his name in headline again.
sentences.cn: 他因自己的名字再次出现在大字标题上而喜形于色.

sentences.en: I'm Claudia Polley with the news headlines.
sentences.cn: 我是克劳迪娅•波莉，以下是新闻提要。

sentences.en: It does so directly, as headline price indices include some oil - related goods.
sentences.cn: 这种作用非常直接, 因为总体物价指数包括一些与石油相关的商品.

sentences.en: The article bore the headline " Conversation and Confrontation ".
sentences.cn: 文章标题为 " 对话与对抗 ".

sentences.en: The banner headline leaped out at me from the newspaper.
sentences.cn: 报纸上的通栏标题跃然映入我的眼帘.

sentences.en: The Daily Mail has the headline "The Voice of Conscience"
sentences.cn: 《每日邮报》的头版标题为“良知的声音”。

sentences.en: The headline ratio of exports to GDP is very misleading.
sentences.cn: 出口占GDP的数据很容易误导人.

sentences.en: The newspaper's headline indicates that there was a trade-off at the summit.
sentences.cn: 报纸的大字标题表明峰会上大家作出了妥协。

sentences.en: This news headline is written in equal - line face letters.
sentences.cn: 报纸上的这条新闻标题用的是等线体.

sentences.en: Yes, it was the headline achievements that had impressed Colonel Baxter.
sentences.cn: 是的, 正是这些轰动一时的成就给巴克斯特上校留下了很深的印象.

sentences.en: You know what the headline was the day before the election?
sentences.cn: 你知道选举前一天报纸的头条是什么 吗 ?

words.tran_cn: 写标题的记者；头牌人物
大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻

trans.tran_cn: 大字标题，新闻提要，头条新闻
trans.tran_en: the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report

trans.tran_cn: 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传
trans.tran_en: to give a headline to an article or story
